trial_identification.studytitle: fun n healthy in Moreland! A 5-year school-community-based health promotion and obesity prevention study for primary school children.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A 5-year study in primary school children of a multi-strategy, community-based intervention promoting healthy eating and physical activity compared to standard school activities on Body Mass Index (BMI) and quality of life.

interventions.interventions: Interventions are multiple strategies over 5 years within primary schools and the community to build the community's capacity to promote healthy eating and physical activity with the use of community development workers provided to the schools. Examples include school food policies, improving school food services such as school canteens, school physical activity programs, curriculum on healthy eating and healthy bodies, activities promoting self esteem, playground redesign, and parent and community engagement.
interventions.comparator: Comparison group is exposed to background activities in the region with no specific intervention strategies instituted.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline (2004) and at follow up (2009).

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Captured at baseline (2004) and will be measured again at follow up (2009). Environmental impact changes will be measured mid-way in 2007.
Captured at baseline (2004) and will be measured again at follow up (2009). Environmental impact changes will be measured mid-way in 2007.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Behavioural indicators of healthy eating and physical activity
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Captured at baseline (2004) and will be measured again at follow up (2009). Environmental impact changes will be measured mid-way in 2007.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Environmental assessments of school and home food and physical activity

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Inclusion for measurement: male and female students in Years prep-6 in selected schools in intervention and comparison areas within the City of Moreland.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of this study is to test the impact of a community-based program aimed at promoting healthy eating and physical activity on changes in Body Mass Index (BMI) in primary school students. The hypothesis is that a community development/health promoting schools approach will reduce the levels of overweight and obesity in this group.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Primary schools in the City of Moreland. Approved by: the Deakin University Human Research Ethics Committee
